prompt: <description>**Construct the Base Part** The base part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. It is centered on a white background. **Step 1: Draw the 2D Sketch** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 2. On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, draw a closed loop consisting of the following line segments: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0825, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0825, 0.0], End Point [0.0825, 0.0056] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0825, 0.0056], End Point [0.0675, 0.0056] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0675, 0.0056], End Point [0.0675, 0.0113] - Line 5: Start Point [0.0675, 0.0113], End Point [0.0675, 0.0169] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0675, 0.0169], End Point [0.0825, 0.0169] - Line 7: Start Point [0.0825, 0.0169], End Point [0.0825, 0.0225] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0825, 0.0225], End Point [0.0, 0.0225] - Line 9: Start Point [0.0, 0.0225], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Scale the 2D Sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0825. **Step 3: Transform the 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. **Step 4: Extrude the 2D Sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.75 units along the normal direction to generate the 3D model. The resulting part will be the base part of the assembly. **Additional Information** - The base part has a length of 0.0825 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.0825 units. - The base part is created using a "NewBodyFeatureOperation" boolean operation, which results in the creation of a new solid body.</description>

Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system a. Draw line 1 from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.6667, 0.0) b. Draw line 2 from point (0.6667, 0.0) to point (0.6667, 0.75) c. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.3333 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction **Instructions for part\\_2** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1.
